Class Post

java.lang.Object
Post
public class Post extends Object
The Post class represents a post with an associated photo, caption, date, and likes. The class provides methods to retrieve and manipulate the post information, including resizing the photo and generating a formatted string representation of the post.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    PHOTO_SIZE
    The desired size for the resized photo.

  • Field Details

    • PHOTO_SIZE

      public static final int PHOTO_SIZE
      The desired size for the resized photo.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Post

      public Post(String photoString, String caption, String date, int likes, int retweets)
      Constructs a new Post with the specified photo, caption, date, number of likes and retweets!
      Parameters:
      photoString - The file path of the photo.
      caption - The caption of the post.
      date - The date of the post.
      likes - The number of likes on the post
      retweets - The number of retweets on the post
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if retweets is less than 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if either dimension is less than PHOTO_SIZE

    • Post

      public Post(String photoString, String caption, String date)
      Constructs a new Post with the specified photo, caption, and date. The post has a random number of likes and a random number of retweets.
      Parameters:
      photoString - The file path of the photo.
      caption - The caption of the post.
      date - The date of the post.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either dimension is less than PHOTO_SIZE

    • updatePhoto

      public void updatePhoto(Color[][] pixels)
      Updates the photo of this post to match the given 2D array of Color objects. Does not represent the photo filename!
      Parameters:
      pixels - The 2D array of Color objects representing the new photo.

      Decreases the number of likes on the post by 1.

    • retweetPost

      public void retweetPost()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the post, including the resized photo (spaces with background colors), the caption, number of likes, number of retweets, and the date.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the post.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Compares with Post with the provided Object This Post is equal to the provded Object if the Object is a Post and both Posts have the same photo pixels, caption, date, likes, and retweets.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The Object to check against this Post for equality
      Returns:
      The boolean equality result
